Well, I’ll be waiting for you, just come up when you’re done.

Okay, I’ll be up in, (looks at the letter) 18 pages. Front and back.
Very exciting.

Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumes

I’ve got canned goods.

Ohh.
Hey!
How was the beach?

What happened?

Me too.
Okay, I’m gonna put this (her suitcase) in the car.

What the hell happened on that beach?!

Hey!

Okay, well umm, I know that we haven’t talked in a long time, but

Right, okay, the one that lives in Montuak, umm-hmm.

No, I umm, I read about her in Mom’s suicide note.

you still have it?

(disgusted) Hang on. (She goes into her apartment and slams the door in
Phoebe’s face.)
I can’t believe you didn’t tell me there was a suicide note!
Yeah. So how have you been doing?
I, umm, shut up!

(reading from the note) “Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I’ll miss

Well, it’s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You
read the poem, right?
Noooo!!

All right, hang on! (She takes the note, goes back into her apartment
and slams the door shut.)
Pass the cheese, please.
My God, you can’t even look at me! Can you?
Nope.
(jumping up) Hey! Phoebe! We can talk to Phoebe!!
No. I’m-I’m to depressed to talk.
I’ll give you a thousand dollars to talk to us.

(coming back in with Rachel) Hey, you guys! What do you, what do you think

NO!!!
All right, that’s it, you guys! What happened out there?

What? We took a walk, nothing happened. I can back with nothing all over
me.
Come on!
What happened? Joey?
All right. (gets up)
(stopping him) No! Joey, we swore we’d never tell!
(running over and joining Monica) They’ll never understand!

Well, we have to say something! We have to get it out! It’s eating me

(interrupting) All right!! All right. (walks slowly into the living
